comment: She is very hard but you learn a lot. She gives a lot of work, but if you work hard she will give you a good grade.
awful! really inconsiderate of students work and opinions. very disrespectful!

Professor Giddens was a bit intimidating to me at first. Being fresh out of HS, I had to bend over backwards with all her writing. I did indeed hate her class for a bit, but you really get responsible and learn a lot from the lady. She's extremely good at her job, and I really wish I could've fit her into my schedule.

very good teacher but lots of work...she came in to class seemingly high on cough syrup which was very funny. really takes the time to read the work that you do but its alot fo work. take her she will make you learn!

She is fabulous & is always responsive to questions (in class & via email). It is a lot of writing (& reading) & if you don't like to write, do not take this class. It is also too much like a history class, so if you are looking for traditional literature, this is not it; however, I did develop more appreciation for this because of her ethusiasm.

If not too much reading then far too much writing, not including the research project and the poetry project. If you want a good grade then you are going to really have to work for it. DO NOT take this class if you are looking for an easy lit class. More work than a freshman comp class.
hates guys and in class discusion gets angry over nothing very quickly
She's a very good teacher.  There is a lot to write, but she appreciates you more if you put in the work, and it will pay off for you in the end.  She's very helpful and very fair.

If you are one of those people who can hit random constant deadlines and keep track of a lot of minor assignments take her.  The class isn't hard, its just tedious. Example: Write an essay by next week but post online, as a blog, your rough draft, super rough draft (double/triple the word count), different perspective of the draft and final draft.
I really liked this class. There are tons of blogs to complete, and your entire grade consists of 3 portfolios. Do the assigned readings and turn everything in on time and complete!! I got an A!
